story.text: (Adds analysts' estimates, share price)SAN FRANCISCO Jan 3 (Reuters) - Clothing retailer Men's Wearhouse (MW.N) on Wednesday backed its fourth-quarter profit outlook, saying net earnings per share would range from 72 cents to 76 cents. The company also said it sees earnings per share before items of 68 cents to 72 cents. The retailer's fiscal fourth quarter ends Feb. 3. Analysts, on average, have been expecting the retailer of suits and sport coats to post fourth-quarter net earnings per share of 74 cents, with adjusted earnings of 75 cents, according to Reuters Estimates. Shares of Men's Wearhouse rose 34 cents or 1 percent in extended trade to $38.68 after closing on the New York Stock Exchange at $38.34.
story.title: update 1 - men ' s wearhouse backs fourth - quarter profit outlook
